comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Signs in the photo show this was the Chatham Square station. City Hall is not shown, but the tall building at upper right is the 40-story Manhattan Municipal Building, first occupied in 1913. The view is approximately southwest along Park Row. Cowperthwaite & Sons, at center, was a large home furnishings company founded in 1807, and located at 193-205 Park Row in Chatham Square. The sign on its building says "now in its 106th year", dating the picture to not before 1913. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manhattan_Municipal_Building books.google.com/books?id=ZHcxAQAAMAAJ&pg=PA78-IA10&a... This picture was probably taken to illustrate the January 17 1916 opening of an express line at the station (the left hand platform in this picture, with tracks going on an upward grade). select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F50811FD3B5B1773... All of these tracks and structures have been demolished.
